title: Anthropology of Development
description:
This course examines anthropological approaches to global development.
Students will gain exposure to major transformations in development
paradigms and become familiar with various theories and processes for
redressing social and economic inequality. Through ethnographic case
studies of specific methodological strategies for intervention, students will
be able to critically analyse diverse development discourses and practices
and evaluate their social consequences, both planned and unintended.
Students will also explore the numerous roles anthropologists have played
in shaping key debates within development and the discipline’s
contributions to understanding the lived experiences of those involved in and effected by development practices.
